result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Anthony M. Shoemaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Ordered  joint and several with A.W.H.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with A.W.H.
May be expunged if defendant successfully completes probation and the diversion agreement on count 1.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to the victims.  How you think this impacted the victims and what you are doing to make amends.  To be pre-approved by his agent.

from State of WI CIB
This judgment is vacated this 1st day of July, 2016 at 10:17 am.  Jan Moennig, Clerk of Court.  See notes in court record.
This judgment is vacated this 1st day of July, 2016 at 10:17 am.  Jan Moennig, Clerk of Court.  See notes in court record.

Received a call from one of the victims.  He received the notice of judgement, which was entered upon information obtained from DOC. The victim advised me that the defendant paid the restitution to DOC, but apparently the agent did not collect the DOC 5% fee, so the DOC fee was deducted from the victim's checks. The victim is pursuing this issue.  The victim wanted us to know that the restitution was paid so that we would vacate the judgments against the defendant, that were entered in error, based on information that was received from DOC.

records.addlTxt: destroyed FIDR

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney White.  Court advised the charges and potential penalties.  Defendant understood.  Victim notification complied with.  Defendant plead no contest to counts 1 and 2.   Plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements reviewed with defendant.  Defendant understood.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation with conditions on count 2.  Two year diversion agreement on Count 1.  Felony warnings given.  Court ensured defendant understood his responsibilities in the diversion agreement.  Defendant stated he understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.   Court found the defendant made his plea and waived his rights freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Court withheld finding on Count 1.  Find guilty of Count 2.  State: 1  year probation on Count 2.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. o/m employment.  $1,000.00 restitution J&S with A.W.H.  Attorney White agrees and requests that the defendant be able to apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation and the diversion agreement.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1  year probation on Count 2.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC. o/m employment.  $1,000.00 restitution J&S with A. W. H., plus surcharges.   LOA to the victims.  How you think this impacted the victims and what you are doing to make amends.  LOAs to be approved by his agent.  No contact with A.W.H.   Diversion agreement approved on Count 1.  No DNA surcharge or swab.  If the defendant successfully completes probation and the diversion agreement the charges may be expunged.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel Richard White.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the state.  Waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Pretrial and status dates set.  Bond continued.

Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Roger L or Austin H nor their residence or property owned by either of them.
